I've released a new testing tool called Concordion that lets you write
test=
s in plain English. Well kinda. In HTML.

Take a look at:  http://www.conco=
rdion.org/

Readable JUnit tests are difficult to write. You can put a desc=
ription
of the behaviour in the name of the test method. E.g.
testStrikeDef=
aultsToSpotPrice()
But the internals of the method still tend to be a mess =
of test data
and plumbing code.

This is where Concordion steps in...

Basi=
cally the tool lets you write a requirement specification in plain
English =
and then turn it into an automated JUnit test. It separates
test data and t=
he plumbing code.

Please try it out. The tutorial takes about 5-30 mins (d=
epending on
how fast you type). The software is new and may have some rough=
 edges,
but I would really like some feedback about the idea, and gather
su=
ggestions for future enhancements etc.

David
